simon edens said he is looking at long term plans for the force .

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
do n't forget northampton saints take on sale tonight in the premiership .
if you want to follow that , there is live commentary on bbc radio northampton .
meanwhile if you want to follow northampton town taking on charlton at sixfields tomorrow in league one , head to our twitter feed .
we 'll be back on monday at 08:00 .
have a good weekend .

documents.title: weather : rain later , but feeling mild
text: a mainly dry evening , but rain will spread across the whole of the bbc east region later .
it 'll turn misty , but feel mild with temperatures falling to 7c ( 44f ) .
a grey and misty start to the weekend , with outbreaks of rain .
it will become drier and brighter by saturday afternoon , with sunny spells by the end of the day .
feeling mild , with temperatures reaching 11c ( 52f ) .
visit bbc weather for more details where you are .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: arthur brumhill trial : jury sent home until tuesday
text: the jury in the trial of stuart jenkins , accused of murdering arthur brumhill ( at a northampton pet shop in 1993 , has been sent home for the weekend .
they will return to northampton crown court on tuesday to continue their deliberations .
mr jenkins , 41 , of ossett , west yorkshire , .
denies killing the 76-year-old shop worker , who body was found in the basement of denton 's pet and garden shop on wellingborough road .
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: eventing competition abandoned on saturday
text: the british eventing competition at aston-le-walls , between daventry and banbury , which was scheduled for tomorrow has been abandoned due to heavy rain .
the event , which includes dressage , show jumping and cross country , was due to run all weekend .
the organisers say a decision on sunday 's competition will be made at 15:00 tomorrow .
author: Laura Cook
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: saints ' trip to sale 'good fun ' against 'tough team ' , says mallinder
text: northampton saints take on sale in the premiership this evening .
director of rugby jim mallinder , who spent 15 years at sale as a player and coach , told me that going back is `` always good fun '' .
mallinder said it 's `` a difficult place to play '' and the 20:15 kick-off was `` quite unusual '' .
mallinder warned that even though sale `` do not have many household names '' they are a `` tough team to beat because they all play for each other '' .
he 's also predicted some running rugby , despite the forecast wind and rain , saying sale bring their backs into the game , and `` they do n't just play kicking rugby '' .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: weather watchers : wild ( ish ) northamptonshire
text: the weather has n't been baa'rilliant , but our bbc weather watchers have been busy capturing the wildlife of northamptonshire this week .
here 's a selection of the that made us smile
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: magic moments from fa people 's cup # peoplescup
text: cheeky chips , celebrations and managerial sackings - watch 10 magic moments from the first round of the fa people 's cup

you 'll be able to watch a highlights programme from the first round of the nationwide five-a-side competition on the iplayer from 06:00 gmt saturday , 4 march and on the red button from 14:10 gmt on saturday and throughout the weekend .

documents.title: on this day : saints ' edgar mobbs captains england against france
text: in 1910 , on this day , northampton saints legend edgar mobbs captained england to an 11-3 win over france in paris .
it would be his final england cap .
mobbs retired from rugby aged 30 and later joined the army to fight in world war one .
he was mentioned in dispatches twice and awarded the distinguished service order , but died while charging a german machine gun in the battle of passchendaele on 31 july 1917 .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: local paper round-up : concerns over development clearance work and tea party for homeless pets
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: a 'beast ' of a car - hamilton
text: i think it 's safe to say that after five days of pre-season testing , stevenage 's lewis hamilton is rather happy with his northamptonshire-designed car for 2017
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cobblers need 'a bit of nous ' , says boss edinburgh
text: cobblers manager justin edinburgh says there 's no panic in the team as they prepare to play charlton tomorrow .
defeat to oldham on tuesday leaves northampton town just four points off the drop zone with 11 games left in the season .
edinburgh told me there was `` frustration and anger because we should have been securing points when we have n't '' .
he said the side needs to have `` a bit of nous '' , but added : `` that means a change in mindset and [ that ] change takes more than eight games . ''
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: weather : cloudy with persistent rain developing
text: it 's been a rather wet day so far .
the rain will start to ease through the afternoon though , with some parts having a dry end to the day , with a high of 9c ( 48f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: northants reveal reduced losses in 2016
text: northants reveal reduced losses in 2016

documents.title: shortage of detectives affecting all forces , says chief constable
text: one of the issues the police watchdog identified in its report about northamptonshire police yesterday was `` a high proportion of serious and complex crimes being dealt with by trainee detectives '' .
chief constable simon edens said the workload on his detectives was `` quite big and quite demanding '' .
however , he said it reflected a national problem , and .
hmic warned there was now a `` national crisis '' caused by a shortage of detectives .
mr edens said it had appointed a new detective chief superintendent , who will be starting with the force `` soon '' .

he also said the police and crime commissioner had found an extra £ 2m for the force , but when asked if that was enough , and whether he wanted more money , he replied : `` no public sector leader would turn away extra resources . ''
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northants announces decrease in financial losses
text: northamptonshire have announced reduced losses for the financial year ending 30 september 2016 .
the club made a loss after tax of £ 182,119 , compared to £ 391,304 in the 2015 financial year .
turnover for the year increased by over £ 100,000 , helped by an increase in prize money from the club 's victory in the t20 blast last season .
`` i am exceptionally proud of this result and financial turnaround , '' chairman gavin warren .
said .
`` it is testament to the hard work and belief that has gone on in the past two-and-a-half years by all stakeholders involved with northamptonshire county cricket club . ''
an update on a proposed share offer will be given at the club 's agm on 30 march , after members voted to make the club a limited company .
in september .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: police chief looking at long term plans for the force
text: echoing what the police and crime commissioner told me yesterday , the chief constable of northamptonshire police , simon edens , said there was no `` quick fix '' to problems identified in the hmic report , which said the force `` requires improvement '' .
the police watchdog said there were inconsistencies in the quality of investigations carried out by the force .
it said investigating and safeguarding domestic abuse victims also needed to be improved , along with the way it handled organised crime - especially gang violence .
but mr edens told me if he brought in changes that just `` looked good '' or were `` cosmetic '' , then `` no-one would forgive me when it went wrong '' .

mr edens said he was looking at long-term plans for the force , but he was `` very confident '' he had `` the right people in the right places , the right number [ of people ] and the right skills '' .
he told me the hmic `` quite rightly set a high bar , '' but the force was `` daily protecting people from harm '' .
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire police not improving 'quick enough ' , says chief constable
text: the chief constable of northamptonshire police said he `` accepts the verdict '' of police watchdog hmic , which yesterday said the force `` requires improvement '' .
the report said the county force was not making progress in the same way similar forces had .
simon edens said northamptonshire police was improving , `` but not quick enough '' .
mr edens said resources were an issue .
`` we 've had to take a huge number of police officers out of the force between 2010 and 2015 to make sure our books are balanced , '' he said .
however , he added there was `` some great work being done '' by the force , and he was `` working very hard to fill those gaps '' identified by the hmic .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lewis hamilton on f1 testing : 'the fastest i have ever been '
text: the formula 1 teams are halfway through their pre-season programmes following this week 's test in spain , and it is just becoming possible to view shapes of the year to come .
the 2017 season heralds a revolutionary change to the cars , following rule changes aimed at making them deliberately faster for the first time in decades .
the drivers have been revelling in the higher cornering speeds and greater demands on their skills .
over four days at the circuit de barcelona-catalunya .
this week .
stevenage driver lewis hamilton could hardly contain his enthusiasm when it came to describing the sensation of driving his brackley-designed mercedes this week .
`` the car is amazing , '' the triple world champion said .
`` it is definitely the fastest i have ever been in f1 . ''
`` turn nine [ a 160mph uphill right-hander ] , i am going out of it and i am like a kid on a rollercoaster ride because it is so much better than before . ''
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: weather : turning wet through the morning
text: after what looks like a promising start , cloud will thicken with persistent and occasionally heavy rain spreading north .
through the morning .
the rain will hang around the further north you are for much of the afternoon , but further south things will clear .
a cloudy end to the day for most of us .
highs today of 10c , that 's 50f .
check the latest forecast for where you live with bbc weather .

text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire .
tomorrow among other things we 'll be building up to another busy weekend of sport with the saints in action on friday night and northampton town making the trip to charlton .
any breaking news will appear on this page this evening and overnight .
we 'll see you tomorrow from 08:00 .

documents.title: watch : peter bone on the rights of eu citizen post-brexit

peers defied ministers by 358 to 256 to guarantee the rights of eu nationals living in the uk after brexit .
but the wellingborough conservative mp peter bone told evan davis that the amendment was not needed .

will people be deported ?

they will continue their deliberations at 10:00 tomorrow .
mr jenkins , 41 , of ossett , west yorkshire , .

documents.title: new defibrillator could save lives at northampton parkrun
text: a potentially life-saving defibrillator has been installed at the racecourse in northampton following fundraising from the town 's parkrun .

organisers of the 5km run , which takes place every saturday morning , decided to buy the machine after hearing stories about runners who had suffered heart attacks during parkruns in other parts of the country .
the northampton event has seen a boost in the number of attendees , with more than 500 people taking part in recent runs .
some of the volunteers took part in training on how to use the defibrillator on wednesday night .
race director mark timmins said it is vital to have such equipment available .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: kettering council freeze their part of council tax , but everyone else proposes rises
text: kettering borough council has decided not to increase its share of council tax for the next year .

but east northamptonshire council has joined the county 's other district and borough councils in putting up their share of the tax by the maximum they are allowed without a referendum , either £ 5 a year or 1.99 % .
however , people in kettering will still pay more because the county council and the police share of the tax is going up .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: weather : becoming mainly dry later
text: it 'll feel chilly in the wind today , but it will become mainly dry by this afternoon , with some sunny spells developing and a high of 9c ( 48f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: northampton to end stadium : mk matches
text: northampton to end stadium : mk matches

documents.title: arthur brumhill trial : jury retired to consider verdict
text: the jury at the trial of stuart jenkins , who is accused of murdering arthur brumhill in northampton in 1993 , has retired to consider its verdict .
mr jenkins , 41 , of ossett , west yorkshire , denies killing the 76-year-old pet shop worker , who body was found in the basement of denton 's pet and garden shop on wellingborough road .
mr jenkins was arrested at the time , but was later released .
the former army sergeant worked at the pet shop for about a month in 1992 , aged 17 , on a youth training scheme .
he denies murder .
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: new saints chairman says there will be no premiership games in mk
text: john white , who will take over as chairman of northampton saints at end of this season , has said that all club 's regular season games will be played at franklin 's gardens .
the saints will still play next month 's premiership game against saracens at stadium : mk , where they have also played european games .
`` home '' games played away from northampton have proved unpopular with some fans .
white , who played at the saints in late-1970s , said that it was n't a reflection on stadium : mk and the club would `` never say never '' about moving future games .
he described franklin 's gardens as `` a unique stadium that is the envy of all of the other premiership clubs and many in europe '' .

documents.title: rugby union : saints make one change for trip to sale
text: northampton saints make just one change for the premiership trip to sale , from the side that beat worcester last weekend .
second-row james craig comes in for christian day .
with tom wood on england duty , ben foden continues to captain the side and also stays on the wing with george north away with wales .
the game kicks off at the odd time of 20:15 tomorrow evening .
your saints are
# legendofrugby that is @ twitterid in the starting line up as deserved go easy on ur old team 2nt @ twitterid @ twitterid
sad i ca n't come up & watch - a weekend of night shifts for me instead
hopefully catch u both soon @ twitterid still to sort that dinner out
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: lewis hamilton not running today , but 'ca n't wait ' for next week 's testing
text: after being scheduled to take his car out in today 's artificially wet testing in barcelona , lewis hamilton has said that an `` electrical fault '' has meant he wo n't be able to take his brackley-based mercedes out after all .
testing resumes next tuesday and hamilton says he `` ca n't wait '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: forth day of formula 1 testing , and it 's wet in barcelona ( sort of )
text: the formula 1 teams are back out at the circuit de catalunya in barcelona .
the track will start wet today , after it was artificially dampened last night after testing had finished and again this morning .
the idea is to provide some testing for pirelli 's new wet tyres .
racing director mario isola said he hoped the teams would get running on the `` extreme '' and `` intermediate '' tyres .
but it is unclear how many will take them up .
lewis hamilton , for one , did not sound at all keen , joking he might find he had pulled a muscle in the morning .
however , hamilton is down to test his brackley-based mercedes , while sergio perez is out in his silverstone-based force india .
you can follow the action on the bbc sport website .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: six nations : hartley says he will be better captain after italy lesson
text: england captain dylan hartley says he should have reacted sooner to italy 's tactics in his side 's six nations win at twickenham on sunday .
the azzurri controversially .
chose not to engage in rucks , .
creating widespread confusion in the england ranks .
hartley has taken responsibility for his side 's failure to adapt quickly before recovering to win 35-16 .
`` as a player , as a captain , as a man , you are never the finished article .
i am still learning , '' he said .
author: Chris Jones
BBC rugby reporter

documents.title: no 'short term gimmicks ' to improve northamptonshire police say pcc
text: northamptonshire 's police and crime commisioner said that neither he or the chief constable `` find where we are acceptable '' .
but stephen mold said he was `` not going to take some short term gimmick to improve [ the force ] '' .
he added : `` i 'm comfortable we are heading in the right direction , but we are not there yet . ''
mr mold , the conservative pcc who took over the role last may , said `` crime has changed significantly '' , with the rise of online offending and `` the force has got to change significantly '' .
however , he said : `` i do n't think northamptonshire gets a good enough funding deal the money from central government has gone down year-on-year . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police 'have not made improvements ' while other forces have
text: the hmic has criticised northamptonshire police for inconsistencies in the quality of investigations carried out in the force , saying they were not always allocated to appropriately-trained staff , and that some serious and complex crimes are being investigated by trainee detectives .
it also went on to point out that investigating and safeguarding domestic abuse victims also needs to be improved as does the way it handles organised crime , especially gang violence .
hm inspector of constabulary zoë billingham concluded the report by saying that she is `` disappointed with the lack of progress northamptonshire police has made since the last inspection ''

she said : `` whereas in forces across england and wales we have seen a general improvement in the areas inspected , northamptonshire has not made significant improvements , although it has a range of plans to do so . ''
however , the report also praised the way the force responds to those at risk of child exploitation .
it also says that staff and officers are hard-working and doing their best to keep the public safe .

documents.title: police force 'requires improvement ' and there is a 'lack of progress '
text: northamptonshire police has been told it `` requires improvement '' by the police standards watchdog .
her majesty 's inspectorate of constabulary ( hmic ) also said the county force had shown `` a disappointing lack of progress '' since its last assessment .
the hmic says northamptonshire police requires improvement in all four areas of police work they assess :

a national study of police effectiveness shows a third of forces in england and wales were given an overall rating of a requiring improvement , but hmic inspector zoë billingham said whereas police forces had generally shown improvement , northamptonshire police had not .
though she did add that the force recognises its weaknesses and is on a journey to transform its performance .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: turning brighter through the day
text: after a chilly and cloudy start , it will gradually turn brighter with some sunny spells .
there 's a chance of a few light showers , but the day will be mostly dry .
temperatures reaching 9c ( 48f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: hello there .
we are back with live updates for northamptonshire .
today we 'll be looking at what the police inspectorate has said about the county force .
and dylan hartley has been speaking about england 's last outing in the six nations against italy .
but first up the weather .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire .
thank you for joining us .
tomorrow we 'll have details of a report by her majesty 's inspector of constabulary into northamptonshire police .
it 'll say how well the force is performing .
we 'll be back from 08:00 .
see you then .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: your questions : is there link between village names starting with 'th ' ?
text: using your questions david finnigan asked : leicestershire has a lot of villages beginning with the letters `` th '' is there a link ?
i 've compiled a list of towns/villages in the county starting with these letters : thurmaston , thrussington , thurnby , thornton , thringstone , theddingworth , thurcaston and thurlaston .
there are also a few with `` thorpe '' but i 'll get onto them .
dr richard jones from the university of leicester has said most of these contain scandinavian personal names , such as thormothir ( thurmaston ) and thorsteinn ( thrussington ) .
most of the place names also have `` tun '' at the end - dr jones said that was old english for `` estate , farm , village '' .
he does n't however believe there is any kind of link between the towns .
however , professor john martin from de montfort university said he was pretty sure the `` th '' at the start of place names was a variation of the term `` thorp '' meaning small hamlet or village .
we have a few of those in leicestershire as well - thorpe satchville , thorpe astley , thorpe arnold thorpe langton .
he said it 's also quite common at the end of village names - like countesthorpe .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tonight 's weather : windy and wet
text: tonight there 'll be outbreaks of rain , heavy at times , but becoming largely dry in the south .
the winds are expected to eventually increase , possibly gusting 40-50mph .
that means it 'll be a windy start to thursday with rain or showers for a time in the north of the region .
by the afternoon , everywhere should be fine and dry with long sunny spells , and the winds should have eased .
highest temperatures of 10c ( 50f ) .
for more , head to bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: seventh person in court charged with murder of liam hunt
text: a seventh person has appeared at northampton crown court charged with the murder of teenager liam hunt , 17 ( below ) .
he was stabbed in northampton on 15 february .
the 16-year-old boy who appeared in court today ca n't be named for legal reasons .
he was arrested on friday .
he has been remanded in custody and will appear in court again on 19 may , along with six other defendants .
they include four boys aged 16 and 17 , aaron joseph , 20 , of hylands road , walthamstow , east london , and james dodd , 18 , of sentinel road , northampton .
they have all been remanded in custody .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: local paper round-up
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: robbery at burton latimer shop
text: cash and cigarettes were stolen in a robbery at a burton latimer store yesterday evening .
two men jumped over the counter at one stop and took the items , using a crowbar to force open the main till , northamptonshire police said .
they ran out of the shop soon after the theft at 18:45 , followed by a third man who had been seen waiting outside .
they drove off in a silver volkswagen passat .
the first offender was described as white and he wore a navy hooded top with the hood up , a green covering across his face , gloves and he carried a crowbar .
the second man was described as white and he also wore a navy hooded top with the hood up , a dark green gilet , a covering over his face , jeans and gloves .
the third man wore a north face jacket , a dark hooded top with the hood up , a white covering across his face and gloves .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: jack the cat reunited with northampton family seven years after going missing
text: a black and white cat is back with his northampton family after being found 60 miles away - seven years after he went missing .
jack was found in chiswick , west london , with a large abscess on his face and was taken to the rspca 's putney animal hospital for treatment .
they discovered a microchip linking him to an address a few streets from where he was found .
a phone call located jack 's owner , sam tendall ( above ) , who is now living in northampton .
prisca giddens from the rspca said : `` who knows what had happened to jack in those seven years ? ''
the charity is advising owners to microchip their pets .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: demand for school places 'continues to rise '
text: more northamptonshire parents are securing their first preference for secondary school than last year , according to the county council .
as we reported earlier , 82 % got a first preference school compared to 80 % last year .
but northamptonshire fares worse than some neighbouring counties .
in central bedfordshire the figure is 97 % , it 's 93 % in cambridgeshire and 85 % in milton keynes .
matthew golby , conservative cabinet member for children 's services and education , said : `` this year has seen the demand for school places continue to rise in northamptonshire . ''
one new school in northampton is wootton park , which had its first intake of children in september .
its principal , dan rosser ( below ) , said : `` northamptonshire needs 31 new schools in the next five years and we are delighted to work with the county council to help fill that demand . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: northampton university academic to advise united nations on crime
text: dr helen poole from the university of northampton is among 25 experts invited to speak at a united nations conference .
she will discuss how education for young people can prevent crime , terrorism and corruption .
dr poole has been invited to the event in vienna by the un office on drugs and crime .
the un 's education for justice initiative is designed to support the integration of crime prevention into all levels of education .
last year , dr poole jointly led a project into gun crime across europe .
in october she began her job at the university of northampton as deputy dean of the faculty of health and society .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: 'first day ' of spring
text: it 's the first day of spring - at least according to the meteorological office - and kathy from sibbertoft has posted this rural scene .
the astronomical start of spring is the vernal equinox .
that 's when the night is the same length as the day , and it takes place on 20 march .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: college 's wellingborough site could be sold or developed
text: as mentioned earlier , tresham college says it now expects to keep a presence in wellingborough , but there is still a question over the future of its town centre campus .
plans to build a £ 16m campus in the town ( above ) were cancelled last year .
interim principal ioan morgan said : `` there is the potential that it [ the town centre campus ] could be sold for development to help our finances .
`` there is also the potential that we could use some or part of that site to build a more suitable , modern provision that our students deserve . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: tresham confirms future in wellingborough
text: tresham college has told the bbc it now expects to keep a presence in wellingborough after months of doubt about its future in the town .
a new campus costing £ 16m was granted planning permission in 2014 .
the existing campus on church street has been partially demolished and just a few students remain there , but the development was cancelled last year .
following the announcement of a merger with bedford college , tresham says it plans to retain and possibly expand the courses it offers in wellingborough .

interim principal ioan morgan , said : `` the current provision on that site , which is confined to motor vehicle training , is going to continue until the summer of 2018 , by which time we will have formulated our plans for a much more comprehensive provision for wellingborough . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: schools website 'frustrates ' parents
text: parents in northamptonshire were left without information about which secondary school their children would be attending in september .
details were due to appear on the county council 's website this morning and circulated by email .
but the relevant section of the website was not working and emails were not sent .
the problem has since been fixed .
northamptonshire county council apologised and said it was `` deeply frustrated '' by the problem .
the council said the number of children getting their first preference school had increased to 82 % this year , while 96 % got one of their three preferences .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: corby lottery tickets 'to be refunded '
text: tickets that have been sold for a council lottery are to be refunded , because the local authority has not yet been awarded a licence .
earlier we mentioned tickets were already being sold online after a mistake by a third party .
the council told the bbc that 55 tickets had been issued to 24 people .
adrian sibley , corporate director at corby borough council , said : `` these will have to be refunded .
we will get in touch with all of the new 24 individuals concerned over the next couple of days to do this . ''
the lottery is being set up to raise money for local good causes .
the ability to buy tickets has now been disabled .
a message on the website says : `` you will be able to buy tickets for corby lottery from tue 7 march 2017 . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: lottery launched without a licence
text: tickets have been sold for a new lottery run by corby borough council , even though a licence has not been awarded .
gambling commission rules say a lottery should not be promoted without a licence , but yesterday a website went live and tickets could be purchased .
after the bbc raised the issue , the ability to buy tickets has been disabled .
corby borough council said the third party that runs the website was operating under previous advice from the gambling commission that has since changed .
it added the appropriate licence would be obtained `` soon '' .
the lottery is being set up to raise money for local good causes .
the first draw is expected to be on 25 march , with a jackpot of up to £ 25,000 .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: extra officers on patrol as penalties for using phone while driving get tougher
text: the penalties for motorists using mobiles are being increased from today .
those caught using their phone illegally will receive six points on their licence and a £ 200 fine , and will no longer be offered a place on a driver awareness course instead of getting points .
northamptonshire police says it will have extra officers on patrol in marked and unmarked cars over the next week to catch offenders .
the force detected nearly 600 drivers using phones behind the wheel last year .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: the weather : march will start on a bright note
text: it 's going to start out bright , with sunny spells , but perhaps the odd isolated shower for much of the day .
cloud will increase and will bring rain to some areas during the evening from the southwest .
it 'll feel chilly in the rather brisk west or south-west winds .
maximum temperature 9c ( 48f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates from northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome back to live updates of news , weather , travel and sport for northamptonshire .
we 'll be here until 18:00 and the full weather forecast will be with you shortly .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northampton town 1-2 oldham athletic
text: northampton town 1-2 oldham athletic

documents.title: murder accused 'heard about death on tv '
text: murder accused 'heard about death on tv '

documents.title: that 's it from us
text: live updates have now finished for northamptonshire .
tonight northampton town take on oldham at sixfields - we 'll bring you a round up of the action tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
let 's hope the players wo n't be eating too many of these before they go out on the pitch
but why not impress your friends by giving this a go tonight ?
enjoy pancake day , and see you in the morning .

documents.title: evening weather update : possible frost tonight with rain tomorrow
text: it will be a cloudy start to the night , with showers and longer spells of rain continuing to push in from the west .
skies will then clear and temperatures could fall low enough in some sheltered spots to allow a frost .
wednesday will get off to a cold and bright start .

thicker cloud and rain will eventually push in from the south-west , but there is still some uncertainty as to how quickly this will happen , and how far north the rain will get during daylight hours .
there 'll be light to moderate south-westerly winds and highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
weather .
has a more detailed forecast for where you live .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: england 'froze ' at italy 's tactics , says jim mallinder
text: the rugby world is still talking about england 's 35-16 win over italy on sunday .

not because england won again , but rather the team were completely thrown by italy 's novel tactic of not committing any men to the breakdown beyond the initial tackler - meaning no ruck was formed and the offside became irrelevant .
northampton saints director of rugby jim mallinder told me england `` actually froze '' and `` thought too much about it rather than play what is in front of them '' .
england captain and saints hooker dylan hartley was left asking referee romain poite to explain the laws of the game - the frenchman testily telling him to ask his own coach .
mallinder said : `` england were a little bit slow to adjust to the situation .
i would be disappointed if our lads did n't recognise the simple thing was to the ball up and run through the middle . ''
italy coach conor o'shea defended the tactic and mallinder said the game was `` fascinating '' .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: arthur brumhill murder trial : accused found out about 1993 death 'on tv '
text: a former army sergeant accused of murdering a northampton pet shop worker in 1993 told a court he found out about the killing while watching the tv news .
stuart jenkins told jurors he played no part in the death of 76-year-old arthur brumhill , who he got on well with .
mr jenkins , now 41 , denies killing mr brumhill and covering his body with straw at the wellingborough road store on 21 january 1993 .
giving evidence to northampton crown court , mr jenkins denied confessing to the killing to two people and said he did not know who had murdered mr brumhill .
mr jenkins , who lives in ossett , west yorkshire , was arrested in 2015 following a review of evidence in the case .
the court heard his fingerprints were found on a bag that had contained straw .
the jury is expected to retire to consider its verdict later this week .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: italy tactics 'may come to premiership '
text: italy tactics 'may come to premiership '

documents.title: pc declan gabriel : police force accepts not guilty verdicts
text: northamptonshire police says it accepts the not guilty verdicts returned in the case of police officer declan gabriel .
pc gabriel , 28 , was cleared of rape and two counts of sexual assault at northampton crown court .
the jury failed to reach a verdict on the fourth charge of misconduct in a public office .
the prosecution is considering whether to seek a re-trial .
ch supt mick stamper , from northamptonshire police , said : `` we will now discuss the outcome of this process with the crown prosecution service to determine the next course of action .
`` the court process is still ongoing and it would be inappropriate for us to comment further at this stage . ''
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: cobblers target 50 points so they can 'enjoy ' their football
text: northampton town manager justin edinburgh says they have a `` real opportunity to put a buffer '' between them and the drop zone - with two back-to-back home games .
oldham are the visitors to sixfields tonight .
they 've not lost in four games , while northampton town are unbeaten in three at home .
edinburgh said the 50-point mark is still the aim and they are trying to get there as soon as possible , `` because it makes it easy to go and enjoy [ games ] '' .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: police officer cleared of teen rape
text: police officer cleared of teen rape

documents.title: local paper round-up : 'dangerous ' excavation , meeting over rothwell development , and retail for daventry
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pancake world record for northampton weather presenter
text: northampton weather presenter laura tobin , who does the forecasts on itv 's good morning britain , got her day off to a flipping good start

documents.title: weather : chilly and unsettled with some sunny spells
text: it 'll be mostly dry with some sunny spells for much of today , but showers and longer spells of rain are expected later this afternoon .
it will turn increasingly breezy too , and it will continue to feel chilly with a high of 7c ( 45f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : record-breaking jaffa cake
text: warning : do n't watch this if you 're hungry .
market harborough 's frances quinn ( who you might recognise from the great british bake off ) has gone into the record books for making this - the largest jaffa cake .
frances tweeted earlier to say her certificate from guinness world records has arrived .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pc declan gabriel : not guilty of rape and sexual assault , but may face a retrial on misconduct charge
text: as we 've been mentioning , a northamptonshire police officer has been cleared of raping and sexually assaulting a 17-year-old girl while on duty .
however , the northampton crown court jury failed to reach a verdict on whether pc declan gabriel ( had committed misconduct in a public office .
the prosecution has two weeks to decide whether it will seek a retrial .
the trial heard the officer attended an incident in northampton in 2015 where a teenager had been thrown out of her house .
the court was told the girl spent two hours with pc gabriel as he tried to help her find somewhere to stay .
the teenager , who can not be named for legal reasons , told a social worker the next day the officer had `` forced himself on her '' after parking in a lay-by , the jury heard .
however , mr gabriel claimed he parked near northampton crematorium to briefly stretch his legs .
on his return he said his underwear had become `` extremely uncomfortable '' and claimed the girl sexually assaulted him while he was readjusting his clothing .
his defence team told the court the teenager 's evidence contained `` several demonstrable lies '' .

documents.title: breakingpc declan gabriel : jury fails to agree on misconduct verdict
text: the jury in the case of pc declan gabriel has been discharged after failing to agree on a verdict on the charge of misconduct in a public office .
the prosecution now has 14 days to decide whether to seek a retrial .
earlier the northampton crown court jury cleared the northamptonshire police officer of rape and two counts of sexual assault .

documents.title: as one football stadium is demolished , work on another stands still
text: it 's a fair point , john !
as nene park gets demolished , yesterday we told you kelvin thomas said work on sixfields ' east stand was `` in the council 's hands '' after grinding to a halt once more .
we are hoping to find out more about what 's happening at the cobblers ' stadium next week .
a sad moment for many football fans as demolition starts at nene park
one stadium being demolished , one ca n't be built # sixfields
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new robot part of £ 2m redevelopment of kettering hospital pharmacy
text: a new robot has been installed at kettering general hospital to help prescriptions .
the machine has been installed as part of a £ 2m redevelopment of the site 's pharmacy department .
the hospital is also installing `` thumbprint-secure '' drug cabinets .
chief pharmacist duane mclean said the pharmacy `` has largely been unchanged for the past 20 years '' , despite seeing an increase in demand for medicines of more than 50 % .
he said it would free up more time for staff to speak to patients about their medication
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingpc declan gabriel : not guilty of rape and sexual assault
text: the jury at northampton crown court has found pc declan gabriel not guilty of rape and two counts of sexual assault .
it is still considering its verdict on the charge of misconduct in a public office .
we 'll bring you more when we get it .

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: nene park demolition : 'a waste ' , 'a shame ' and 'shearer up front ' ?
text: yesterday we brought you footage of the demolition of nene park getting under way .
the former home of rushden and diamonds and kettering town in irthlingborough has been empty since 2012 .
you 've been getting in touch with your views on facebook .
chris davies wrote : `` dreadful that this has happened .
should have been a resource for the local community . ''
cathy richards wrote : `` total waste of money it 's not that old either , this should not be happening . ''
graham moore said : `` fantastic small ground with top class playing surface .
such a shame . ''
irene smith-linnell wrote : `` devastating , what a waste .
i can remember my son playing a cup game there .
fond memories as they won . ''
meanwhile , myles ferraro recalled the diamonds ' special up-front partnership that he created in a virtual world : `` so sad , played there for 4 seasons on fifa 2005 .
had shevchenko and shearer upfront . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dogs sniff out 2,500 packets of illegal cigarettes
text: trading standards and northamptonshire police have uncovered illicit tobacco in northampton , kettering and corby , with the help of sniffer dogs yo-yo , phoebe , scamp and harry .
they discovered almost 2,500 packets of illegal cigarettes and 134 pouches of illegal hand-rolling tobacco .
investigations are ongoing as a result of the raids .

andre gonzález de savage , county council deputy leader and cabinet member for public protection , said : `` illegal cigarettes not only pose a risk to people 's health , but those involved in their sale are often linked to other forms of criminal activity including drug dealing , money laundering , people trafficking and even terrorism . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: silverstone - sunnier than spain ?
text: it 's the second day of testing of the new formula 1 cars for the 2017 season .
silverstone-based force india are in spain
but maybe they should have stayed at home
@ twitterid @ twitterid the sun is definitely shining today # thewing # silverstone
good morning from a gloomy and grey @ twitterid yesterday 's sun is gone as day 2 of testing starts .
# f1testing
car not ready yet ?
please change the colour and design of the trucks
getting exciting now !
sun is in yeovil ! !
looks a bit chilly
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hammer and samurai sword attack leaves teen with facial injuries
text: a teenager was attacked with a hammer and a samurai sword in kettering at the weekend , northamptonshire police said .
three men went to an address on church mews , judith road , and attacked the 18-year-old victim , causing facial injuries .
two men aged 23 and 20 and a 17-year-old boy have been arrested .
police are trying to trace witnesses as part of the investigation .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lewis hamilton fastest for mercedes on first pre-season testing day
text: mercedes and ferrari had impressive starts to pre-season testing as red bull and mclaren hit trouble .
stevenage 's lewis hamilton was fastest as brackley-based mercedes completed 152 laps with both their drivers at circuit de catalunya .
hamilton was 0.113 seconds faster than sebastian vettel 's ferrari , which also ran reliably and used the slower medium tyre with the mercedes on the soft .
hamilton 's team-mate valtteri bottas , a replacement for the now-retired world champion nico rosberg , was sixth fastest .
today is the second day of testing in spain and you can follow the action on the bbc sport website .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: weather : sunny intervals and scattered showers
text: after a chilly start , some sunny intervals will occur along with scattered showers .
some of the showers could fall as sleet or hail , and may also be heavy .
it will feel cold in the wind , with a high of 7c ( 45f ) .
here is my full forecast
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire .
today we 'll be finding out how robots are helping at kettering general hospital .
plus there is a build up to northampton town 's league one game against oldham .
but first up the chilly weather .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: that 's all from us today
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 .
but any breaking news will appear here this evening and overnight .
you can read more on the increase in the number of suspected online child sex offenders in northamptonshire , and see more on the story on bbc inside out tonight .
however , there 's no other way to end tonight 's feed but to say rip nene park .
read more on the demolition below .
see you again tomorrow .

documents.title: video : nene park demolition begins
text: this was the sad scene in northamptonshire today as bulldozers began tearing down rushden and diamonds ' former nene park stadium in irthlingborough - home to this writer 's first ever football match .

the diamond burgers are most definitely off the grill and pet shop boys ' go west is no longer blaring from the speakers instead they 're replaced by the sounds of concrete being broken up and the smell of dust in the air .
the club , which began in 1992 , rose through the tiers , reaching the former division two before financial woes led to their ultimate demise in 2011 .
the club that emerged from the ashes , afc rushden and diamonds , currently play in the northern premier league division one south and are due to relocate from wellingborough to rushden .
arch rivals kettering town took over the site briefly , but it 's been redundant for five years .
it 's not yet known what will become of the site but no doubt many local supporters , like me , will be shedding a tear or two tonight .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: weather : a cold night , with the risk of frost and ice
text: a mixture of clear spells and scattered showers across the bbc east region tonight , some heavy and locally wintry with hail .
it 'll become cold with a risk of frost and ice and temperatures falling to 0c ( 32f ) .
weather has a more detailed forecast for where you live .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: pc declan gabriel : jury sent home
text: the jury has been sent home for the day in the case of a northamptonshire police officer accused of raping and sexually assaulting a 17-year-old girl while on duty .
pc declan gabriel denies one charge of rape , two counts of sexual assault and one count of misconduct in a public office .
the alleged attacks took place in an unmarked police car in two lay-bys in northampton in 2015 , northampton crown court heard .
the jury will resume deliberations tomorrow .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: online child sex abuse cases treble
text: the number of online child sex abuse suspects identified in the east of england has nearly trebled in just three years , according to official data .
a freedom of information request by the bbc revealed more than 2,000 people were identified by eight police forces in 2016 , compared to 758 in 2014 .
the number of cases is said to have left at least one police force overwhelmed .
det supt andy rogers , from northamptonshire police , explains the problems faced by forces
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: the highs and lows of nene park
text: following the start of demolition work at the nene park football stadium in irthlingborough , here 's a potted history of the site .
nene park was opened in 1992 to be the home of rushden and diamonds , formed by dr martens owner max griggs
among the highlights of their time at the ground was the fa cup third round match against leeds united in 1999 .
they drew the tie 0-0 , forcing the replay at elland road .
the club , which at its peak played in the old division two , also hosted several top level sides in pre-season friendlies , including arsenal
in 2005 billy sharp scored a last minute winner for the diamonds against northampton town in league two
the ground also saw the managerial debut of current cobblers manager justin edinburgh
after the club folded in 2011 , it briefly became home to kettering town
however , after they moved out in 2012 it remained empty - and today work to knock the 6,000-capacity stadium down began
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bomb disposal team in little addington after 'sus substance ' found
text: a man in his 40s has been arrested after a bomb disposal team was called out to a village in the east of the county to deal with a `` sus substance '' .
police and fire crews were called to a property on chapel hill , little addington , at about 08:00 on saturday .
the area was sealed off and the explosive ordnance disposal ( eod ) team called , leading to the evacuation of a number of nearby homes .
today , personnel from the eod and other experts supported police to recover a number of `` potentially harmful substances '' from the property .
northamptonshire police have thanked residents for their patience while the area was made safe .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: football stadium demolition under way
text: bulldozers have started demolishing the former nene park football stadium in irthlingborough .
the former home of rushden and diamonds has n't been used since kettering town left there in 2012 .
last week the mp for corby and east northamptonshire , tom pursglove , said he had been unsuccessful in convincing the stadium 's owners to save at least part of the ground for community use .
the demolition work will take four months .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local paper round-up : samurai blade , corby hit-and-run and pancake fun in daventry
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: redevelopment of sixfield 's east stand 'in council 's hands ' , says thomas
text: the redevelopment of the east stand at sixfields is `` in the council 's hands '' , according to northampton town chairman kelvin thomas .
under the previous owners the work stalled and most of it was not completed .
almost 2,000 seats were put in last year .
after mr thomas took over , but little has been done since .
mr thomas told the cobblers ' youtube channel .
the club had `` done everything we need to '' and was `` waiting to hear back from [ northampton borough council ] '' .
he said `` hopefully we can get some issues resolved '' , but did not say what the issues were .
we have contacted the council for comment .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : turning colder , with sunny spells and wintry showers
text: it will be a colder day than of late , with showers possible throughout the day .
however , it will be less windy than yesterday , with some sunny spells likely this afternoon .
any showers may turn wintry , with a high of 8c ( 46f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: pc declan gabriel : jury retires to consider verdicts
text: the jury has been sent out to consider its verdicts in the case of a northamptonshire police officer , who is accused of raping and sexually assaulting a 17-year-old girl while on duty .
pc declan gabriel denies one charge of rape , two counts of sexual assault and one count of misconduct in a public office .
the alleged attacks took place in an unmarked police car in two lay-bys in northampton in 2015 , northampton crown court heard .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: 'big blow ' as cobblers ' striker alex revell suffers injury setback
text: cobblers ' striker alex revell wo n't be available for tomorrow night 's game with oldham at sixfields .
he 's suffered a setback on his recovery from a calf injury , which he gained in last month 's defeat at mk dons .
justin edinburgh told me it was `` a big blow '' .
author: Caroline Densley
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: saints sign south african scrum-half cobus reinach
text: northampton saints have signed the south african international scrum cobus reinach for next season .
the 27-year-old joins from durban-based team , the sharks .
director of rugby at the saints , jim mallider , said they been watching reinach `` for some time '' .
reinach told the saints website : `` i 'm delighted and excited to be joining northampton .
it is a club with a long tradition and strong values and i 'm really looking forward to playing at franklin 's gardens and being in their environment . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northampton sign scrum-half reinach
text: northampton sign scrum-half reinach

documents.title: gleeson to miss north v south series
text: northants ' fast bowler richard gleeson is set to miss the north v south series in dubai next month .
the 29-year-old is being treated for a knee injury .
gleeson was the steelbacks ' most economical bowler in last year 's successful t20 campaign and was named in the north squad with county colleagues ben duckett and graeme white .
the north v south series will be making its debut this year , introduced as way of showcasing the best players in limited-over county cricket .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: online child sex cases rise dramatically
text: the number of suspected online child sex offenders identified across northamptonshire has risen dramatically in three years , .
the bbc has discovered .
in 2014 northamptonshire police identified 33 people suspected of downloading and distributing indecent images of children , but by last year that figure had increased to 210 .
pc jason callum , from northamptonshire police 's paedophile online investigation team , said the force was `` definitely '' overwhelmed by the number of cases .
part of the problem is parents letting children go on the internet from as young as four years old , mr callum said .
he added the force was only `` now getting the true feel of what is going on out there '' .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: f1 testing begins in barcelona
text: this morning the first day of f1 pre-season testing at spain 's circuit de catalunya has begun .
it 's the first time fans and pundits will get to see how this year 's cars will run .
among those testing today are both brackley-based mercedes drivers , with lewis hamilton out this afternoon and valtteri bottas already on the track
sergio perez is also testing for silverstone-based force india
we 'll bring you any significant news from spain through the day .
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: liam hunt : seventh person due in court after teen death
text: a seventh person - a 16-year old boy - is due before magistrates this morning charged with murdering teenager liam hunt , having been arrested on friday .
liam , 17 , was fatally stabbed in the neck during an attack on st george 's street , northampton , on 14 february .
six other people have already been charged with murder .

they include four boys aged 16 and 17 - who can not be named for legal reasons - aaron joseph , 20 , of hylands road , walthamstow , east london , and james dodd , 18 , of sentinel road , northampton .
all six have been remanded in custody .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: monday 's weather : unsettled with showers , heavy at times
text: it 's a reasonably mild start , but this week it 'll get much colder .
it 'll be an unsettled day , with some frequent showers , which could be quite heavy as well .
they 're blown through on fresh south-westerly winds .
there may be some hail mixed in the showers , some thunder , and some lightning potentially as well .
top temperature : 7c ( 45f ) .

documents.title: welcome to live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning .
we are back with updates for northamptonshire .
between now at 18:00 we 'll be bringing you the latest news , weather , sport and travel .
already this morning we have learned that the number of suspected online child sex offences across the east of england has nearly trebled in three years .
we 'll have more news throughout the day - but first up the weather .

BBC Local Live
